summary: Build a future-proof, Play Store–compliant hybrid Android app for viralprompts.in that uses https://viralprompts.in/data.json as the single source of truth, provides native list/detail UI with offline caching and manual refresh, and opens full prompt pages via WebView without harming SEO or duplicating website content.
architectural_notes: Hybrid approach: native list/detail screens; WebView only for full pages at https://viralprompts.in/{urlTitle}.
Single source of truth is public JSON at https://viralprompts.in/data.json; JSON structure must not change; any transformation is app-side.
Construct image URLs using base https://viralprompts.in/ + image path from JSON.
Support runtime theme switching (dark/light) via an in-app toggle; ensure colors remain consistent with website-inspired palette.
known_issues: Prompts are not loading for the user (data fetch/parsing/caching issue suspected); needs investigation and fix.

existing_features.title: Fetch live prompt data from the public JSON endpoint https://viralprompts.in/data.json via HTTPS and support the JSON structure exactly as provided (no schema changes or assumptions about additional fields).
Construct prompt image URLs by prefixing the JSON "image" path with the base URL https://viralprompts.in/ (e.g., "uploads/x.jpg" -> "https://viralprompts.in/uploads/x.jpg").
Implement app-side transformation of the "howToUse" field by splitting the string into ordered steps using newline separators ("\n"), without modifying the source JSON.

Create a fast, Play-Store-quality UI with two primary screens: (1) a prompts list screen showing image, title, categories, and copiedCount; (2) a prompt detail screen showing description, prompt text with a copy-to-clipboard action, parsed how-to-use steps, and a button/link to open the canonical full page.

Open full prompt pages only at https://viralprompts.in/{urlTitle} as the canonical source; the app must avoid positioning its own rendered content as the canonical SEO surface (i.e., do not generate or expose crawlable duplicate pages intended to rank).
Add offline-safe local caching for the fetched JSON data and provide manual refresh logic so content can update without requiring app releases.

Add a coherent, consistent visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) appropriate for a "prompt library" product; avoid blue/purple as dominant brand colors unless explicitly requested by the user.
Include user-facing copy in English that is policy-safe (no misleading superlatives like “No.1”, “Best”, or “Guaranteed”) and clearly states that content is fetched live from viralprompts.in.

Document Play Store compliance risks and operational requirements the user called out (including 20 testers / 14 days testing expectations for 2025–2026) as a brief in-repo note for release planning; do not require backend changes.

Fix the issue where prompts are not loading by improving fetch robustness and adding actionable error recovery in the UI (without changing the https://viralprompts.in/data.json schema or assuming new fields).
Add a dark/light theme toggle button in the app UI (similar to common website theme toggles) and persist the user’s choice locally so it survives refresh/reopen.
Add a simple Options/Settings area that includes a few user-configurable preferences (in addition to theme), implemented purely on the frontend with local persistence.
Update and refine the app color styling so it remains similar to the current website-like warm palette but looks more polished and consistent across components in both light and dark mode.

new_feature_requests.summary: Hybrid Android app (Kotlin, minSdk 21+) with native list/detail UI plus WebView for full website pages at https://viralprompts.in/{urlTitle}
Fetch and parse live JSON from https://viralprompts.in/data.json (structure supported as-is) with app-side transformations (e.g., parse howToUse steps)
Offline-safe local caching plus manual refresh logic for JSON content (no app updates needed for content changes)
List screen UI: image, title, categories, copiedCount
Detail screen UI: description, prompt with copy button, parsed how-to-use steps, and button to open full page on website
SEO & Play Store policy compliance: avoid duplicate content, position website as ranking asset, compliant store listing claims, and align with 2025–2026 testing requirements
Add a user-facing dark/light theme toggle button (similar to the user’s website UI) and align the app color palette with the website while improving overall branding
Add a simple Options/Settings area ("thoda options add karo") for user-configurable preferences
